metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20566 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In l2cap_chan_put of l2cap_core, there is a possible use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-165329981References: Upstream kernel Lee Jones discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the Bluetooth implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1116-aws - 4.4.0-1116.122
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-azure - 4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-lowlatency - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-azure - 4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-lowlatency - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1116.122').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1').
